rev.comment: /* 2007-2010: CTUWS closure, lawsuit, and prison sentence */ image added

Line 66: Line 66:
==2007-2010: CTUWS closure, lawsuit, and prison sentence==
==2007-2010: CTUWS closure, lawsuit, and prison sentence==
  +
[[File:Kamal Abbas.jpg|thumb|Kamal Abbas during the 2010 National Minimum Wage protest]]
In 2007, after Mahala Al-Kobra textile workers threatened to impeach him for allegedly staging fraudulent union elections in October 2006, General Federation of Trade Unions (GFTU) President Hussein Megawer denounced Abbas as a "foreign-funded agent" on the satellite TV channel Dream 2. Megawer argued that CTUWS should be shut down; closure of the Naja Hamadi branch followed almost immediately.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2007/843/eg4.htm |work =[[Al-Ahram Weekly]] | title=Workers remain undaunted |date= |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref>
In 2007, after Mahala Al-Kobra textile workers threatened to impeach him for allegedly staging fraudulent union elections in October 2006, General Federation of Trade Unions (GFTU) President Hussein Megawer denounced Abbas as a "foreign-funded agent" on the satellite TV channel Dream 2. Megawer argued that CTUWS should be shut down; closure of the Naja Hamadi branch followed almost immediately.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2007/843/eg4.htm |work =[[Al-Ahram Weekly]] | title=Workers remain undaunted |date= |accessdate=2011-07-10}}</ref>
